intro: Psychotria carapichea, commonly known as the "Amazonian Psychotria," is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical rainforests of South America, particularly Brazil, Colombia, and Peru. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to greenish flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the undergrowth of dense forests. Psychotria carapichea is also known for its psychoactive properties, containing alkaloids such as harmine and tetrahydrocannabinol.
